title: The Abbot
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "A truce with your cant phrase and your solemn foppery, Lundin," in suchterms she accosted the man of art, "and let me know instantly, if thoucanst tell, whether this lady hath swallowed aught that is less thanwholesome?"

title: The Abbot

title: The abbot /
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " A truce with your cant phrase and your solemn foppery, Lundin,"in such terms she accosted the man of art, ** and let me know instantly, if thou canst tell whether this lady hath swallowed aught that is less than wholesome."

title: The Scottish cavalier;
author: Grant, James
snippet: Led by the laird of Lundin, master of the ordnance, next came the train of artillery, with trumpets sounding and kettledrums  beating; the rnatrosses marching with shouldered pikes on each side of the polished brass cannon ; the fire- masters on horseback, distinguished by waving plumes and golden scarfs.

title: The Scottish cavalier;
author: Grant, James
snippet: on ; Major-General Viscount Dundee led the cavalry ; the laird of Lundin the train of artillery.
